name: Utrecht 3
author: Will Brouwers
body:
Historie

Two ships were found in the Waterstraat in Utrecht in 1974: the Utrecht 2 (extended logboat) and the Utrecht 3 (an almost complete barge).

The Utrecht 3 was discarded and reused as revetment /quay works.

Beschrijving

It was a large flat-bottomed vessel of 23 by 3.3 to 4 meters. Dendrochronological research dates the ship after around 1004. The wood comes from the Ardennes. The Utrecht 3 shows many construction similarities with Deventer I and II.

Status

  • Wynia, H., 2015: Pompeii aan de Rijn. Bijzondere Utrechtse scheepsvondsten, Oud Utrecht 88, juni, 80-87
  • Brouwers, W./E. Jansma/M. Manders, Middeleeuwse scheeps- resten in Nederland

Referenties

  • Brouwers W, Jansma E. Manders M. (2015).
    Middeleeuwse scheepsresten in Nederland, de vroege middeleeuwen 500-1050.
    Archeobrief, 3.
